Countable Smorgasbord

most things are broken most of the time

Blogroll

There is far too much quality produced out there for me to name everything I like. If you’re somewhat crazy, here’s my feedly opml. Otherwise, a sample biased towards the better sources:

Mathematically Precise Blogs and other writing

  • Distill
  • Statistical Modeling, Causual Inference, and Social Science: See the name. Andrew Gelman and friends.
  • The Endeavor
  • Computational Complexity
  • What’s New: Better math writing than most textbooks
  • Nuit Blanche more of a collection of links than anything, but they’re usually good.
  • Gödel’s Lost Letter and P=NP
  • Quomodocumque

Less-wrong/Effective Altruism adjacent

  • Slate Star Codex: needs no introduction
  • [80,000 Hours]
  • Metaculus: help predict the future, learn to think clearly

Broader Blogosphere

  • Scholar’s Stage: A historians’ view of China, behavioral science, and strategic thought
  • Gene Expression: Or Razib’s writing in general. He’s pretty insightful on world history and genetics.
  • Statechery: In depth analysis of the shape of the tech market

Web comics

  • Lackadaisy Cats: THE 20’S, NOW WITH 300% MOAR CATS

  • Ava’s Demon: A young child is possessed by an immortal empress fighting an empire that is not quite what it seems.

  • Kill Six Billion Demons: The multiverse is vast, a young woman is given more power than she knows what to do with and needs to survive.

  • Sword Interval: the supernatural is leaking into the world, and it is emphatically not friendly.

  • Seed: Relatively fast AI take-off done well. So far.

  • xkcd: Occasionally funny. More frequently useful as a common reference point.

  • Saturday Morning Breakfast Cereal: It never ends. How does he do it?
